article.title: The Outer Halo of the Milky Way as Probed by RR Lyr Variables from the Palomar Transient Facility

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the color coding in the phased light curve represent?
choices: Magnitude variations due to the Blazhko effect.
Different pulsation modes of the RR Lyrae stars.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the red curve in the Aitoff projection represent?
choices: The orbital plane of the Sgr stream.
The location of the Pisces overdensity.
The distribution of RR Lyrae stars with distances beyond 85 kpc.

multiple_choice_question.text: What trend can be observed in the median amplitude of RR Lyr candidates with increasing distance?
How can RR Lyrae type c variables be distinguished from RR Lyrae type ab variables in this diagram?
choices: Type c variables have shorter periods and larger amplitudes than type ab.
Type c variables have longer periods and larger amplitudes than type ab.
Type c variables have longer periods and smaller amplitudes than type ab.
Type c variables have shorter periods and smaller amplitudes than type ab.

multiple_choice_question.text: Assuming a median period of 0.553 days for RR Lyr stars, what is the approximate change in distance caused by the period dependence of luminosity?
